titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:18-0400

did.unittitle: Linguistic data in the Sandia dialect of Tiwa
did.abstract: Includes vocabulary; texts; analysis of the Sandia material by an Isleta informant; household items; foods; directions; natural phenomena; buildings; fruits; time expressions; verbs; adverbs; checking George L. Trager's material; pronominal reference; greetings; animal names (including domesticated); festivals; other ethnographic information. Tape 1 includes Tewa (not Tiwa) texts, vocabulary, speech, and song recorded by Ernest Riechert of Wycliffe Bible Translators at Nambe Pueblo, New Mexico.
did.physdesc: 29 sound tape reels (25 hr., 4 min.) : analog, 7 1/2 ips, 2 track, mono ; 7 in.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Presented by Elizabeth Anne Brandt in 1970. This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.

did.unittitle: Audio recordings
Speech from two Tewa speakers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copied on to reel-to-reel tape by Ernest Riechert, Wycliffe Bible Translators. Original recording was made on a cassette recorder.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Audiocassette) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.

did.unittitle: Governing terms & ethnographic information on governing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Predominantly in English, with some Tiwa terminology. Program contains corrupted digital sound quality from RDAT transfer, from 7:34 to 7:55. At 7:46, a three-second silent gap has been left to reflect 20 seconds of signal silence that have been removed at that point.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals note
originalsloc.p: This file is a compressed, digitized version of the original. The APS Library maintains the original format (Sound tape reel) as well as an uncompressed digitized version of this recording.
